alert.note: Alert for Johnson; Laurens; Washington; Wilkinson (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 16 at 6:00AM EST until January 17 at 1:40AM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Georgia... Oconee River at Dublin affecting Laurens, Washington, Wilkinson and Johnson Counties. For the Oconee River Basin...including Dublin...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Oconee River at Dublin. * WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 22.0 feet, Minor flooding continues in the woodlands and natural flood plain along the river upstream and downstream from the gage on U.S. Highway 80. Portions of some dirt river access roads will begin to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:45 AM EST Tuesday the stage was 22.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 5:45 AM EST Tuesday was 23.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 22.2 feet this morning. It will then fall below flood stage this evening. - Flood stage is 21.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 22.3 feet on 03/26/1977. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta. The next statement will be issued this evening at 600 PM EST.
